title: ST558_HW1
text:
What do you think being a data scientist is about? I find Data Scientist to be a very broad term, which include wrangling data, performing analysis, modeling data, and communicating data. This requires
What differences/similarities do you see between data scientists and statisticians? The primary difference I see between data scientist and statisticians is audience. Data scientist are often business centric while statisticians are more research focus. However, both have the overwhelming goal of understanding the data. A statistician might achieve this by finding a model or distribution to understand the underlying population of the data. A data scientist could work to create a model that uses the data to make immediate or long term decisions.
How do you view yourself in relation to these two areas? The role of a statistician more closely relates to some of the theory knowledge I have studied during my master while data science encompasses a lot of appications of statistics and more.

title: ST558_HW1
text:
Running Code

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)
class(y) #class of y

[1] "density"

typeof(y) #type of y

[1] "list"

str(y) #structure of y

List of 8
 $ x         : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y         : num [1:512] 0.00161 0.00178 0.00197 0.00217 0.00239 ...
 $ bw        : num 0.252
 $ n         : int 150
 $ old.coords: logi FALSE
 $ call      : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name : chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na    : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"











The echo: false option is on which prevents the printing of code. The plot shows the estimated density values of the iris petal width.
